channel.description: 11 Additional security considerations []{#11.htm#pgfId-1121654}This chapter []{#11.htm#marker-1124735}covers []{#11.htm#pgfId-1121655 .calibre17}Securing running applications on different standalone servers, inside different VMs and containers []{#11.htm#pgfId-1121656 .calibre17}Running a container via a service versus as a child of the container engine via fork and exec []{#11.htm#pgfId-1121657 .calibre17}Linux security features used to keep containers isolated from each other []{#11.htm#pgfId-1121658 .calibre17}Setting up container image trust []{#11.htm#pgfId-1121659 .calibre17}Signing images and trusting them []{#11.htm#pgfId-1121660}In this chapter, I review and demonstrate some additional security considerations when using Podman to run containers.
